microtool.utils package¶

Submodules¶

microtool.utils.IO module¶

Helper functions for handling the input and output for the microtool module.

class microtool.utils.IO.HiddenPrints¶

Bases: object

Helper class for silencing print statements. Use with HiddenPrints(): whatever you want to do without print statements

microtool.utils.plotting module¶

class microtool.utils.plotting.LossInspector(scheme: ~microtool.acquisition_scheme.AcquisitionScheme, model: ~microtool.tissue_model.TissueModel, noise_var: float, loss_function: ~microtool.optimize.loss_functions.LossFunction = <microtool.optimize.loss_functions.CrlbEigenvalues object>, N_samples: int = 100)¶

Bases: object

compute_loss(x: ndarray) → float¶
Parameters:

x – The scaled parameters for which we wish to know the loss

Returns:

the loss value

plot(parameters: List[Dict[str, int]], domains: List[Tuple[float, float]] | None = None) → None¶

Allows for plotting a loss function as a function of 2 or 1 parameter(s) close to a minimum found by optimization.

Parameters:

  • parameters – A dictionary containing a free parameter name as key and the pulse for which you wish to inspect the loss.

  • domains – The domains for which you wish to inspect the parameters

Raises:

ValueError if domains are out of bounds or if arguments are incompatible

microtool.utils.solve_echo_time module¶

The following expressions were found analytically

microtool.utils.solve_echo_time.compute_delta_max(b, scanner_parameters: ScannerParameters)¶
microtool.utils.solve_echo_time.echo_time(delta, b, scanner_parameters: ScannerParameters)¶
microtool.utils.solve_echo_time.largest_real_cbrt(a2: float | ndarray, a1: float | ndarray, a0: float | ndarray) → float | ndarray¶

Returns the largest real root of the cubic equation z^3 + a_2 * z^2 + a_1 * z + a_0 = 0.

See https://mathworld.wolfram.com/CubicFormula.html for details on solving the cubic analytically.

Parameters:

  • a2 – Coefficient of the quadratic term

  • a1 – Coefficient of the linear term

  • a0 – Constant offset

Returns:

The largest real root(s) in shape (N_parameter values, 1)
